definition: A group of people who are closely related to one another (by blood, marriage or adoption); kin; for example, a set of parents and their children; an immediate family.
Any period of 24 hours.
An act of being of assistance to someone.
The current moment or period of time.
A person or group of people constituting a particular side in a contract or legal action.
(sometimes attributive) Something which supports.
An occurrence; something that happens.
Offspring.
The achievement of one's aim or goal.
An event or community gathering, usually staged by a local community, which centers on some theme, sometimes on some unique aspect of the community.
The act of receiving.
Memory; recollection.
A sequence of rhythmic steps or movements usually performed to music, for pleasure or as a form of social interaction.
The act of recognizing or the condition of being recognized (matching a current observation with a memory of a prior observation of the same entity)
A day that is an exact number of years (to the day) since a given significant event occurred. Often preceded by an ordinal number indicating the number of years.
A part of culture that is passed from person to person or generation to generation, possibly differing in detail from family to family, such as the way to celebrate holidays.
Agreement in a design or plan; union formed by mutual communication of opinions and views; accordance in a scheme; harmony; simultaneous action.
A ritual, with religious or cultural significance.
The anniversary of the day on which someone is born.
An acknowledgment of gratitude, respect or admiration; an accompanying gift.
A day on which a festival, religious event, or national celebration is traditionally observed.
An action or statement in response to a stimulus or other event.
The formal performance of a solemn rite, such as Christian sacrament.
To perform the marriage ceremony for; to join in matrimony.
Something given to another voluntarily, without charge.
A favorable opportunity; a convenient or timely chance.
The act of waking, or state of being awake.
A ceremony to honour and remember a deceased person. Often distinguished from a memorial service by the presence of the body of the deceased.
To extol or honour in a solemn manner.
An organized procession consisting of a series of consecutive displays, performances, exhibits, etc. displayed by moving down a street past a crowd of spectators.
An act of announcing, or giving notice.
A meeting or get-together; a party or social function.
A flag or standard used by a military commander, monarch or nation.
The process or act of reuniting.
The act of demonstrating; showing or explaining something.
The act of accepting; a receiving of something offered, with acquiescence, approbation, or satisfaction; especially, favourable reception; approval.
To extol or honour in a solemn manner.
A very large meal, often of a ceremonial nature.
(Jewish history) A special year of emancipation supposed to be kept every fifty years, when farming was abandoned and Hebrew slaves were set free.
Rite; a repeated set of actions
To extol or honour in a solemn manner.
The hundredth anniversary of an event or happening.
The formal performance of a solemn rite, such as Christian sacrament.
Freedom from some business or activity.
Something of value given in return for an act.
Any of a number of festivals held just before the beginning of Lent.
A fair valuation or estimate of merit, worth, weight, etc.; recognition of excellence.
Food that is prepared and eaten, usually at a specific time, and usually in a comparatively large quantity (as opposed to a snack).
Pomp, show, or festivity.
The act or event of returning home.
The act of commemorating; an observance or celebration to honor the memory of some person or event.
The act of commemorating; an observance or celebration to honor the memory of some person or event.
The act of progressing or proceeding.
The act of remembering; a holding in mind, or bringing to mind; recollection.
An expression of gratitude.
A large party; gala event.
To honour the memory of someone or something with a ceremony or object.
(In Spanish speaking countries) A religious festival.
A cheerful attitude; happiness; a good, happy, or positive mood.
A large celebratory meal; a feast.
To honour the memory of someone or something with a ceremony or object.
(often pluralized) A festival or similar celebration.
The 200th anniversary of an event or happening.
Having the atmosphere, decoration, or attitude of a festival, holiday, or celebration.
The act of relaxing or the state of being relaxed; the opposite of stress or tension; the aim of recreation and leisure activities.
A festival open to the public, the proceeds from which are often given to charity.
The practice of complying with a law, custom, command or rule.
In the manner of, or forming part of, a celebration.
A boisterous or lavish celebration or party.
An extravagant or eccentric piece of music, literature or drama.
The act of glorifying or the state of being glorified.
A scornful or mocking remark; a jeer or mockery
A formal evening party.
A festival open to the public, the proceeds from which are often given to charity.
Church festival celebrating the harvest, held at the end of September or the beginning of October
(often pluralized) A festival or similar celebration.
Joyful or riotous merry-making.
A triumphant shouting; rejoicing; exultation.
A noisy party or festivities.
Joyful festivities, especially as a celebration.
A day that is not one's birthday but is celebrated as though it were.
